author: nhcwebmaster@noaa.gov (NHC Webmaster)
nhc_headline: ...BARRY NEAR THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING LIKELY OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS...
summary: ...BARRY NEAR THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING LIKELY OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS... As of 7:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 21.6, -97.2 with movement NW at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

summary_detail.value: ...BARRY NEAR THE EASTERN GULF COAST OF MEXICO... ...HEAVY RAINS AND FLASH FLOODING LIKELY OVER PORTIONS OF EASTERN MEXICO FOR THE NEXT FEW DAYS... As of 7:00 PM CDT Sun Jun 29 the center of Barry was located near 21.6, -97.2 with movement NW at 8 mph. The minimum central pressure was 1007 mb with maximum sustained winds of about 45 mph.

title: Summary for Tropical Storm Barry (AT2/AL022025)
